related_equipments.name: U-100 BD Ultra-Fine™ Short Insulin Syringes

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9445i","text":"Prepare either virus dilution with PBS prepare. Injection is up to 100 μL per mouse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u8ci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77ps7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33abt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"j864","text":"Take one mouse from the cage into an induction chamber and start isoflurane at 3% with flow rate of ~1L/min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c54hj","text":"After the mouse has slow breathing (~1/s) move the mouse to a nose cone delivery of isoflurane at 1.5% with around the same flow rate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f9sk2","text":"Expose the eye ball with two fingers (above and below) and make sure the you are not pressing on the trachea and the mouse's breathing is regular.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f84jm","text":"Use a 31 G insulin syringe at a 30-degree angle beveled downwards until you hit the bone, retract a bit and slowly inject. See cited paper for more details.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ikmb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ct5h7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30oj1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1gem1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qma0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"align":null,"authors":"Tal Yardeni, Michael Eckhaus, H. Douglas Morris, Marjan Huizing, Shelley Hoogstraten-Miller","can_edit":1,"date":"1303303500","doi":"10.1038/laban0511-155","guid":"8D511EE0AEDD11E9989AEB8A1843E6DC","id":74,"journal":"LabAnimal","protocol_name":"Estimation of small molecule dye delivery to the brain of C57/Bl mice","step_guid":"C987F740AEDC11E9989AEB8A1843E6DC","step_number":"5","title":"Retro-orbital injections in mice"}},"1":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":4026,"brand":"BD Medical","can_edit":0,"guid":"B12DE560EEC011ED9469F51E5F5388E6","link":"https://us.vwr.com/store/catalog/product.jsp?catalog_number=BD328438","name":"U-100 BD Ultra-Fine™ Short Insulin Syringes","sku":"BD328438","specifications":"","type":"Syringe and neecdle","vendor":{"id":521,"name":"VWR International","link":"","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dpso","text":"Remove the needle slowly and press the eyelid shut for a few seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c397","text":"Prior to recovery, apply 1-2 drops 0.5% ophthalmic Proparacaine to the injected eye","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e97hr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
